markdown.markdown:
- January 13: No Lab
- January 20: No Class
- March 3-7: No Classes
- April 7: No Class
- April 9: No Class
- April 11: No Class
- April 28: Community Project Presentation
- 9am, May 5: Project Portfolio Due

## Weekly Schedule

### Week 1 (Jan 13-17): Introduction to Web Design and Tools  
- Topics: Overview of web design, development tools, workflows, and sitemapping  
- Assignments Released:  
  - [Technical Challenge 1: Sitemap](https://classroom.github.com/a/4uWr1dqq)
- Read/Review:
  - Review [CMPSC 104 materials](https://github.com/allegheny-college-cmpsc-104-Fall-2024/classDocs/tree/main/lessons): Git, VSCode, Markdown
  - Read Chapter 1: Basics in [Learn Enough Command Line to Be Dangerous](https://www.learnenough.com/command-line-tutorial)  
  - [Slides: Sitemap](week1/index.qmd)

### Week 2 (Jan 20-24): Markdown, Quarto, and Introduction to Software Engineering  
- Topics: Markdown, Quarto, Wireframing and Software Engineering process
- Assignments Released:  
  - [Web Project 1: Course Website - Sprint 1](https://classroom.github.com/a/TWfWTBaQ)
- Read/Review:
  - Read Chapter 1: Process in [Web Style Guide](https://www.webstyleguide.com/wsg3/1-process)  
  - Read Chapter 1 in [Adaptive Web Design](https://adaptivewebdesign.info/1st-edition/read/)
  - [Slides: Software Engineering Process](week2/index.qmd)
  - [Slides: Quarto and Wireframing](week2_2/index.qmd)
  - [Slides: Sprints](week2_3/index.qmd)

### Week 3 (Jan 27-31): HTML Basics  
- Topics: Structure of HTML documents, semantic HTML, and elements  
- Assignments DUE:
  - Quiz 1 on January 31st
- Assignments Released:  
  - [Technical Challenge 2: Semantic HTML](https://classroom.github.com/a/32KcroMs)
- Read/Review:
  - Review [CMPSC 104 materials](https://github.com/allegheny-college-cmpsc-104-Fall-2024/classDocs/tree/main/lessons): HTML
  - Read [HTML](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML)
  - Read [Markup](https://adaptivewebdesign.info/1st-edition/read/chapter-2.html)

### Week 4 (Feb 3-7): CSS Basics and Design Principles  
- Topics: Design Principles & User Experience 
- Assignments Released:
  - [Technical Challenge 3](https://classroom.github.com/a/f1JC8UnX)
  - [Web Project 1: Course Website - Sprint 2](https://classroom.github.com/a/TWfWTBaQ)
- Read/Review:
  - Read [What is CSS](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn_web_development/Core/Styling_basics/What_is_CSS)
  - Read [Box Model](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn_web_development/Core/Styling_basics/Box_model)
  - Read [Responsive Design](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn_web_development/Core/CSS_layout/Responsive_Design)
  - Read Chapter 3: Universal Usability in [Web Style Guide](https://www.webstyleguide.com/wsg3/2-universal-usability/index.html)
  - Read Chapter 4: Interface Design in [Web Style Guide](https://www.webstyleguide.com/wsg3/4-interface-design/index.html)
  - Read Chapter 6: Page Structure in [Web Style Guide](https://www.webstyleguide.com/wsg3/6-page-structure/index.html)
  - [Slides: Design Principles and Responsiveness](week4/index.qmd)

### Week 5 (Feb 10-14): Advanced CSS and Accessibility 
- Topics: Positioning, layout, accessibility
- Assignments Released:  
  - [Technical Challenge 4](https://classroom.github.com/a/i1_T0PjS)
  - [Web Project 2: Personal Website - Stage 1](https://classroom.github.com/a/7rH6D574)
- Read/Review:
  - Read [Flexbox](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn_web_development/Core/CSS_layout/Flexbox)
  - Read [CSS Positioning](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/position)
  - Read [CSS Grid](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn_web_development/Core/CSS_layout/Grids)
  - Ref: [Web Accessibility](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn_web_development/Core/Accessibility)
  - [Slides: Advanced CSS and Accessibility](week5/index.qmd)

### Week 6 (Feb 17-21): Responsive Design  
- Topics: Media queries, flexible grids, responsive images 
- Assignments DUE:  
  - Quiz 2 on February 21st 
- Read/Review:
  - Read [Responsive web design basics](https://web.dev/articles/responsive-web-design-basics)
  - Read [Responsive Design](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/CSS/CSS_layout/Responsive_Design)
  - Read [Responsive Images](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/HTML/Multimedia_and_embedding/Responsive_images)
  - [Slides: Responsive Design](week6/index.qmd)

### Week 7 (Feb 24-28): Accessibility   
- Topics: More on creating accessible content  
- Assignments DUE:
  - Project 1: Sprint 2 DUE on February 24th by 2:30pm
- Read/Review:  
  - Read [ARIA](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Accessibility/ARIA)
  - Read [Keyboard Accessibility](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Accessibility/Keyboard-navigable_JavaScript_widgets)
  - [Slides: Advanced Accessibility and Internationalization](week7/index.qmd)

### Week 8 (Mar 1-9): Spring Break
- No class meetings. Use this time to rest, reflect, and recharge.

### Week 9 (Mar 10-14): Javascript    
- Topics: JavaScript syntax, DOM manipulation, basic interactivity   
- Assignments DUE:
  - Project 2: Stage 1 Due on March 10th by 2:30pm (Complete a [peer review form](https://forms.gle/UBNRxeRP4ak2bnty6)). Begin Stage 2.
  - Project 3: Requirements Gathering - Community Website. Complete the [Google form](https://forms.gle/X3svVkwGVoUADNW6A) on March 10th.
- Assignments Released:  
  - [International & Intercultural Perspectives Presentation Assignment](https://classroom.github.com/a/RmT-d8O4) 
  - Begin Project 2: Stage 2
  - [Technical Challenge 5](https://classroom.github.com/a/hcAXoH8a)
- Read/Review:
  - Read [Eloquent JavaScript (Chapters 1-6, 10-11, 13)](https://eloquentjavascript.net/)
  - Read [DOM](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document_Object_Model)
  - Ref [JavaScript](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript)
  - [Slides: JavaScript Basics](week9/index.qmd)  

### Week 10 (Mar 17-21): Javascript, Introduction to React  
- Topics: More advanced Javascript, React introduction 
- Assignments DUE:
  - Technical Challenge 5 DUE on March 17th
  - Quiz 3 on March 17th 
  - [IIP Presentations Round 1](https://classroom.github.com/a/RmT-d8O4) on March 21st
- Assignments Released:  
  - [Web Project 3: Sprint 1 - Community Website](https://classroom.github.com/a/2OhxTc65) (March 17th lab)
  - [Technical Challenge 6](https://classroom.github.com/a/FeNyByFg) (March 19th class)
- Read/Review:
  - Read [Eloquent JavaScript (Chapters 14, 15, 18, and 20](https://eloquentjavascript.net/)
  - [Slides: JavaScript Advanced Topics](week10/index.qmd)

### Week 11 (Mar 24-28): Projects
- Assignments DUE:
  - IIP Presentations Round 2 on March 28th
- Assignments Released:
  - [Web Project 1: Sprint 3](https://github.com/CMPSC302-Spring-2025-AlleghenyCollege/designingtheweb.org) (March 24th class)
- Project 3 Work Time (March 24th lab)
- Project 1 Work Time (March 26th class)
- Project 3 Work Time (March 28th class)

### Week 12 (Mar 31-Apr 4): React  
- Topics: React components, props, and state  
- Assignments DUE:
  - Project 2: Stage 2 **Due** on March 31st (presentations during the lab). Feel out [peer feedback form](https://forms.gle/1oTejuogxWirvKLX7) for each presenter.
  - [IIP Presentations Round 3](https://classroom.github.com/a/RmT-d8O4) on April 2nd
  - Quiz 4 on April 4th
- Assignments Released:  
  - Begin Project 2 Stage 3
- Read/Review:
  - [Continuous Integration Example](https://github.com/CMPSC302-Spring-2025-AlleghenyCollege/ci_example)

### Week 13 (Apr 7-9): Projects  
- Assignments DUE:
  - Project 3 Sprint 1 **Due** on April 9th
- Assignments Released:  
  - Begin Project 3 Stage 2

### Week 14 (Apr 14-18): Web Performance Optimization  
- Topics: Minimizing load times, SEO basics, performance audits  
- Assignments DUE: 
  - Project 3 Sprint 2 Progress Review on April 14th
  - [IIP Presentations Round 4](https://classroom.github.com/a/RmT-d8O4) on April 16th
  - Project 1 Progress Review on April 18th

### Week 15 (Apr 21-25): Final Project Development  
- Activities: Web portfolio work time. Show and Tell.
- Assignments DUE:  
  - Extra Quiz on April 21st
  - Project 3 Work Time on April 21st LAB
  - Project 1 Presentations of Completed Features on April 23rd
  - [IIP Presentations Round 5](https://classroom.github.com/a/RmT-d8O4) on April 21st

### Week 16 (Apr 28-May 6): Project Presentation and Reflection  
- Activities: Present final projects, peer reviews, course reflection
- Community project 3 presentations on April 28th
- Project Portfolio with 3 Web Projects Due on May 5th by 9am

### Tabular View

| Week            | Monday Class                             | Monday Lab                                      | Wednesday Class                                   | Friday Class                           |
|-----------------|------------------------------------------|-------------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------|----------------------------------------|
| **Week 10** (Mar 17-21) | TC 5, Quiz 3 |  Project 3: Sprint 1 (Released) | TC 6 (Released) | IIP Presentations Round 1 |
| **Week 11** (Mar 24-28) |  Project 1: Sprint 3 (Released) |  Project 3: Work Time | TC 6 **Due**. Project 1: Work Time | IIP Presentations Round 2. Project 3: Work Time |
| **Week 12** (Mar 31-Apr 4) |  Project 1 Work Time | Project 2: Stage 2 **Due**. [Peer Feedback Form](https://forms.gle/1oTejuogxWirvKLX7). | IIP Presentations Round 3 | Quiz 4 |
| **Week 13** (Apr 7-9) | No Class | No Lab | No Class. Project 3 Sprint 1 **Due**. | No Class |
| **Week 14** (Apr 14-18) | Project 1: Sprint 3 **Due**, begin sprint 4. | Project 3 Progress Review | IIP Presentations Round 4 | Project 1 Progress Review. [Bonus TC (to replace another TC grade](https://classroom.github.com/a/SGykHxmZ) |
| **Week 15** (Apr 21-25) | IIP Presentations Round 5. Extra Quiz. | Project 3 Work Time | Project 1 Demos (all features must be finished).  | Project Work Time.  |
| **Week 16** (Apr 28-May 6) | Project 3 Presentations |  |  |  |

- January 20: No Class
- March 3-7: No Classes
- April 7: No Class
- April 9: No Class
- April 11: No Class
- April 28: Community Project Presentation
- 9am, May 5: Project Portfolio Due

## Weekly Schedule

### Week 1 (Jan 13-17): Introduction to Web Design and Tools  
- Topics: Overview of web design, development tools, workflows, and sitemapping  
- Assignments Released:

### Week 4 (Feb 3-7): CSS Basics and Design Principles

### Week 5 (Feb 10-14): Advanced CSS and Accessibility

- No class meetings. Use this time to rest, reflect, and recharge.

### Week 9 (Mar 10-14): Javascript

### Week 10 (Mar 17-21): Javascript, Introduction to React  
- Topics: More advanced Javascript, React introduction 
- Assignments DUE:
  - Technical Challenge 5 DUE on March 17th
  - Quiz 3 on March 17th 
  - [IIP Presentations Round 1](https://classroom.github.com/a/RmT-d8O4) on March 21st
- Assignments Released:  
  - [Web Project 3: Sprint 1 - Community Website](https://classroom.github.com/a/2OhxTc65) (March 17th lab)
  - [Technical Challenge 6](https://classroom.github.com/a/FeNyByFg) (March 19th class)
- Read/Review:
  - Read [Eloquent JavaScript (Chapters 14, 15, 18, and 20](https://eloquentjavascript.net/)
  - [Slides: JavaScript Advanced Topics](week10/index.qmd)

### Week 11 (Mar 24-28): Projects
- Assignments DUE:
  - IIP Presentations Round 2 on March 28th
- Assignments Released:
  - [Web Project 1: Sprint 3](https://github.com/CMPSC302-Spring-2025-AlleghenyCollege/designingtheweb.org) (March 24th class)
- Project 3 Work Time (March 24th lab)
- Project 1 Work Time (March 26th class)
- Project 3 Work Time (March 28th class)

### Week 12 (Mar 31-Apr 4): React  
- Topics: React components, props, and state  
- Assignments DUE:
  - Project 2: Stage 2 **Due** on March 31st (presentations during the lab). Feel out [peer feedback form](https://forms.gle/1oTejuogxWirvKLX7) for each presenter.
  - [IIP Presentations Round 3](https://classroom.github.com/a/RmT-d8O4) on April 2nd
  - Quiz 4 on April 4th

  - Begin Project 2 Stage 3
- Read/Review:
  - [Continuous Integration Example](https://github.com/CMPSC302-Spring-2025-AlleghenyCollege/ci_example)

### Week 13 (Apr 7-9): Projects  
- Assignments DUE:
  - Project 3 Sprint 1 **Due** on April 9th
- Assignments Released:  
  - Begin Project 3 Stage 2

### Week 14 (Apr 14-18): Web Performance Optimization  
- Topics: Minimizing load times, SEO basics, performance audits  
- Assignments DUE: 
  - Project 3 Sprint 2 Progress Review on April 14th
  - [IIP Presentations Round 4](https://classroom.github.com/a/RmT-d8O4) on April 16th
  - Project 1 Progress Review on April 18th

### Week 15 (Apr 21-25): Final Project Development  
- Activities: Web portfolio work time. Show and Tell.
- Assignments DUE:  
  - Extra Quiz on April 21st
  - Project 3 Work Time on April 21st LAB
  - Project 1 Presentations of Completed Features on April 23rd
  - [IIP Presentations Round 5](https://classroom.github.com/a/RmT-d8O4) on April 21st

### Week 16 (Apr 28-May 6): Project Presentation and Reflection  
- Activities: Present final projects, peer reviews, course reflection
- Community project 3 presentations on April 28th
- Project Portfolio with 3 Web Projects Due on May 5th by 9am
